description:
Restart is a competitive, tactical, time-travel-themed engine-building game. In the near future, humanity collapses into a dystopia. In a last-ditch effort, scientists invent nanochips that allow travelers to move through time and alter events. However, rival alternative futures clash and the prosperity of one means the ruin of another. Will you save your future?

The game unfolds across three timelines: the past, the present and the future. Each player controls a time traveler and their younger past self and has a personal mind board. On their turn, each player activates one of their four mind abilities.


    PERCEPTION: Complete missions on the spacetime grid by spending time.
    INTELLIGENCE: Acquire new missions by interacting with the dystopia.
    MEMORY: Gain resources.
    FOCUS: Upgrade actions by playing cards on your mind board.


Restart features four unique dystopias that are played individually. Each dystopia has distinct mechanics while maintaining the same core system, offering variety and replayability.

—description from the publisher

You are one of the legendary leaders of the Roman Empire. And it’s time to show your mettle. Expand your empire through military conquest. Build infrastructure and glorious monuments. All while keeping the barbarian hordes at bay. Will you bring glory to the  Empire? Or will your reign be just another forgotten page in history?

Rome Alone is a fast-playing solo resource management game.

Draw cards and manage tough decisions about what to use them for each turn. Collect industry, culture and military resources. Spend those resources to conquer regions or build buildings to improve your engine. Or, work towards constructing monuments with powerful  abilities and scoring potential. Be sure to save enough military resources to defend from increasingly menacing barbarian invasions at the end of the round!

At the end of round 3, compare your score to the  history books to gauge your success. Engage in the optional campaign mode to play a connected series of games and determine your ultimate fate. When the challenges start stacking up, will any stand by your side? Do you have what it takes to manage Rome Alone?

—description from the publisher

Today you dreamed your favorite dream again - the same as always. The cows barely fit in the barn, the hens are laying like crazy, and the ears of grain are bending under their own weight. The weather is fine, so you spend a beautiful afternoon outside polishing the paintwork of your new tractor. A neighbor is standing behind the fence, and the edges of his face are slowly but surely turning green with envy... Eh! Fairy tale!

But wait a minute - why a fairy tale right away? Maybe it's time to roll up your sleeves and make this dream come true? Why not? Grab the pitchfork, prepare a plan and turn your farm into a real "dream farm" - the decoration of the area and the habitat of all abundance!

Sit under a tree, put your hands under your head, roll your eyes around your estates and fat livestock and think with satisfaction "it couldn't have been better developed!" What do you have to do to be able to think like that? Earn the greatest wealth: money, equipment, plants and animals. The richest farmer wins!

—description from the publisher

The game contains of 4 phases: development, fortune, trade and race. In development phase players breed their animals. During fortune phase everyone spins the spinner in order to gain or lose some resources. Next is the trade phase, in which players buy and sell plants and animals. And finally the race phase - players flick their tractor pawns on the back of the box from a side to the stump in order to get a animal/plant token corresponding with their specialization. After 12 rounds (or 6 rounds in short game) the player who gather most points wins. The point are awarded for: tiddlywinks tokens, money, specialization tokens, animal/plant tokens, additional cards, green cards.

—user summary

Set in a fantasy world, Drums of War puts each player in charge of an army represented by an asymmetrical deck of cards, led by a commanding hero. Cards are deployed on the battlefield, in the form of units, equipment or tactics, which decimate the deck for each action they perform. In two-player or solo games, Drums of War offers fast-paced, tactical games lasting 30 minutes.

Each player has a deck of 38 cards, from which we will have to draw a certain number, according to the hero we are going to use in the battle. Some heroes force us to draw them at random, while others allow us to choose them. Along the game, we alternatively deploy cards from our hand to the battlefield with the particularity that, to deploy a card, we will have to pay its cost with other cards from our hand. Retired cards, except for specific ability effects, do not return to play during the game… you will have to choose wisely!

Once both players pass, combat takes place between the units deployed on the battlefield.

To win the game you must cause the opponent’s hero as many wounds as his life value indicates, before running out of cards to recover your hand.

—description from the publisher

Ambientado en un mundo de fantasía, Tambores de Guerra pone a cada jugador al frente de un ejército representado por un mazo de cartas asimétrico, comandado por un héroe al mando. Las cartas se despliegan sobre el campo de batalla, en forma de unidades, equipo o tácticas, que van diezmando el mazo por cada acción que realicen. En partidas para dos jugadores o en solitario, Tambores de Guerra ofrece partidas rápidas y tácticas de 30 minutos de duración.

Para ello, cada jugador cuenta con un mazo de 38 cartas, de las que habremos tenido que retirar cierto número, según el héroe que vamos a utilizar en la batalla. Algunos héroes nos obligan a retirarlas al azar, mientras otros nos permiten elegirlas. Durante la partida, desplegamos alternativamente cartas de la mano al campo de batalla con la particularidad de que, para desplegar una carta tendremos que pagar su coste con otras cartas de nuestra mano. Las cartas retiradas, salvo efectos de habilidades concretas, no vuelven al juego durante la partida… ¡tendrás que elegir bien!

Una vez que ambos jugadores pasan se produce el combate entre las unidades desplegadas en el campo de batalla.

Para obtener la victoria debemos causar al héroe rival tantas heridas como indica su valor de vida, antes de quedarnos sin cartas para recuperar nuestra mano.

—description from the publisher (Spanish)

Battle Card: Market Garden is a quick-playing (~5 minutes) solitaire Post-card wargame about one of the most iconic battles of WWII - Market Garden. In the game, the player takes the role of the Allies, controlling the 1st, 82nd, and 101st Airborne Divisions as they try to take control of their sectors and make way for the 30th Corps to reach Arnhem.

The game uses a simple combat results table (CRT) to resolve battles based on whether the Allies or the Germans have advantage.

The player has six turns for the 30th Corps to reach Arnhem or they lose the game.

—description from the designer

Each player receives containers for glass, paper, plastic and organic waste. A waste dump is formed. A plum card market is created. On each turn, players sort waste by placing it in their bins, then have the option to exchange it for plums if they have enough collected waste. In addition to waste, the dump also hides special cards that can help players trade more plums by outsmarting others.

The player who exchanges the most Plums for Trash wins the game.

—description from the designer

A pure luck roll-and-move game themed after Monopoly as a McDonald’s Happy Meal item. The gameplay is different from the previous Happy Meal game. When a player lands on an unowned property, they claim it’s deed. The game ends when all properties are taken.

The components include puzzle pieces that form a board, deed cards, four plastic tokens, and a punched card that folds into a die.

Upwärts! is a fun dice game where the players can pile the numbers they have rolled into a grid. Depending on the different options to get points (arranging numbers in lines, snakes or bricks) the players have to smartly stack the rolled numbers to win. As an additional challenge, the players can use the optional "event die".

How to play: When it's the players turn, he/she rolls all three dice. All players put down the shown numbers on their notepad and smartly sort them into the grid by letting them "fall" into the rows. Each player decides how to stack the numbers to get the highest possible number of points. The different lines, snakes or bricks  have to be made up of the same number, for example, a player could attempt to build a line of number "5" whenever a 5 is rolled in the game.

When the notepad is filled out completely, the players can count the points.

Everything is in butter, boss! is a card game about common phrases. If you translate German idioms into the English language you don't get the correct English equivalent, but rather a funny English sentence. Then it's not English, it's Denglish ("D" for Deutsch = German). So one by one the players draw a card and have to translate the Denglish sentences into German and then also have to find the correct English phrase. Only if a player can translate the Denglish phrase into German and then correctly into English they can keep the card. The more cards the players collect the more points they earn. Whoever earns most points wins.

This version includes idioms about daily routines in the office and business-related topics.

This version of the black stories series features real crimes. These stories are 100% true.

Black Stories are tricky, morbid, sinister riddle stories. The players try to reconstruct the particulars of each incident, piece by piece, by asking yes-or-no-questions.

The successful mystery series "Black Stories" is also available in the "scary-free" version - for families with children from 8 years old.

In this version, which translates to "black stories vacation stories", is designed for vacation time. Whenever the kids are bored while riding the train with the family or stuck in the car on their way to their vacation destination, black stories junior is a great way to pass the time.

100 funny riddles are waiting to be solved.

Tenacity is a quasi-real time arithmetic game. Each turn, a player plays a card to a central stack and announces the sum of the cards in the stack - the card they played and the number said by the previous player.

Each player has a face down "target" chip in front of themselves. If the number announced matches a player's target, the player should grab a stone from the middle of the table. Once the other players see someone grab a stone, they all try to grab a stone as well.

The player who is not able to grab a stone takes the cards from the central stack as a penalty.

The game ends when the deck of cards or target chips are exhausted and the person with the most points wins.

Cartaventura is a collection of narrative card games with an immersive storyline and multiple endings! Players build their adventure with the help of cards that offer different options. They think together about the best choices to follow the trail of the game's hero.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Cartaventura Odyssée est une collection de jeux de cartes narratifs destinée à toute la famille. Vivez de grandes aventures historiques aux multiples dénouements ! Votre objectif : terminer les 3 chapitres de l'histoire et découvrir les 10 cartes secrètes en faisant les bons choix.

Cartaventura Odyssée, c'est l'expérience Cartaventura adaptée à toute la famille, dès 6 ans ! Un système de jeu accessible pour les plus jeunes et qui se dévoile au fur et à mesure de la partie; des univers captivants pour les petits comme pour les grands; et toujours de quoi apprendre en s'amusant, grâce aux contenus pédagogiques rédigés avec des spécialistes.

Chaque scénario de Cartaventura Odyssée se compose de 3 chapitres d'une vingtaine de minutes chacun. Au fil des parties, les joueurs révèlent des cartes secrètes qui donnent accès à de nouvelles portions de l'histoire. En rejouant l'aventure, ils peuvent ainsi découvrir toutes les fins possibles.
Pendant leur aventure, ils débloquent également les 10 cartes Savoir pour apprendre l'histoire de la piraterie tout en s'amusant.nt les bons choix.

—description from the publisher

A racing game with multiple themed decks of cards for racers. Players take control of racers and the first to reach the finish line wins. Each racers has special powers that can alter dice, effect other racers, effect themselves, or the board.

—description from the designer

Players roll the die and place one of their chips in the resulting slot, while sixes allow them to drop a chip directly in the box. The active player can choose to roll again or pass the die. If a player rolls a number that already has a chip in that slot, they must take the chips from all filled slots. Whoever runs out of chips first wins (along with any prize players may have placed inside the box at the start of the game).

Ð‘ÐµÐ·Ð¼Ð¾Ð»Ð²Ð½Ñ‹Ð¹ ÑÐ²Ð¸Ð´ÐµÑ‚ÐµÐ»ÑŒ ("Silent Witness") is a new generation detective game that combines classic board game components and modern technologies. The main tool of the game is a conversation, and then the voice assistant "Alice" (Yandex voice assistant) and any device where she lives will come to your aid.

Texts voiced by professional announcers are waiting for you, with special effects (from opening doors and creaking stairs to parrot screams), but the most important and interesting thing is the reverse dialogue: after discussing the evidence, you tell "Alice" what to do, who to talk to, where to go.

You are the respected Dr. Jekyll, an honorable and philanthropic gentleman of Victorian London. Your life is divided between doing good deeds, making elixir, and controlling your inner monster — the dangerous and impulsive Mr. Hyde. Of course it's not all smooth sailing, but indulging the desires of the odious scoundrel and making money from him helps you to carry out your charitable work. How could it go wrong?

To win Jekyll / Hyde, the Good Deeds Counter must be at 6 and the Impulses Counter at 0 at the beginning of Dr. Jekyll's turn. You lose the game if, at the beginning of Mr. Hyde's turn, the Elixir Counter is 0 or the Tracked Counter is 6. If both counters meet these conditions, you also lose.

In July 1758, the British army made a major push north against Fort Carillon, a.k.a. Fort Ticonderoga. This was part of a three-pronged campaign against New France, led by Major-General Abercromby.

With a massive army of 17,000 men supported by 44 pieces of artillery, the 3,500 French and Canadian defenders were facing overwhelming odds. Due to unforeseen events, the battle turned out to be a decisive victory for the French commander Montcalm and his forces.

1758 Fort Carillon - Abercromby's Fumble at Ticonderoga is a detailed simulation of the battle, starting from the British landing at day break of July 6th. Lead elements included Rogers Rangers.

Each artillery piece and key leader or engineer is individually represented in the game. Combat units are 100 men each. You can build or destroy bridges or earthworks. The game also includes small boats such as bateaux that can be carried over land and larger rafts for artillery. Optional rules include ships from the small French navy on Lake Champlain.

—description from the designer

What is the mark of a true champion? Legendary heroes clash across the Neververse to find out.

Battlecrest is a card-based tactical skirmish game for 2 players (1-4 with expansions). With perfect information, players must truly outwit their opponent to win.

Characters are composed of 6-card sets featuring a hero card, a health tracker, and action cards. Occasionally a minion or item will replace an action card.

The map is built of 6 cards as well, with the cards randomly placed in a set pattern.

Players take turns maneuvering their characters around the dynamic, and often dangerous map while unleashing powerful attacks. As action cards are used they open up new possibilities and empower the character’s battlecrests. Build up to decisive strikes or refocus to get powers back. Every character has a unique set of actions and preferred tactics, so no two battles play the same.


The Metronn Base Game includes two heroes, Kaladeos and Exa (and her minion, Sparkles), and the Metronn map. All in just 18 cards, packed in our little wallets. No additional components are needed to play, though it is compatible with all other Battlecrest products (including the Fellwoods Base Game, the Imperator Solo Expansion, and the team play rules).

Metronn: a massive city filled with neon color and alien architecture. In the labyrinth of alleys between districts a grinning sentrybot chases a twisted figure, bent by dark magic. As their battle explodes suddenly in the middle of the street, bystanders run for cover while cameras broadcast every move to giant screens. Finally, a spectacle worthy of Metronn.


     Metronn Map Set: 6 Landmark cards


On behalf of his order, master header Kaladeos has scoured wraith-corrupted worlds across the Neververse. Now he depends on his healing skills to survive the nidus of dark magic left behind by a grievous wound. The Wraithlock he wears enables Kaladeos to draw on that magic to enhance his body at the risk of becoming a wraith himself.


     Kaladeos Hero set: 1 Hero, 1 Health, 1 Item, 3 Action cards.
     Kaladeos AI Sheet: for solo play, requires Imperator expansion.


Exa was once a simple sentry-bot, a modular android protecting the megawealthy. But years of constants reprogramming and conflicting orders burned out her emotional regulator. Now a merceanry, Exa and her pet turret Sparkles are known for their glitchy dispositions and the devastation they leave in their wake.


     Exa Hero set: 1 Hero, 1 Health, 1 Minion, 3 Action cards.
     Exa AI Sheet: for solo play, requires Imperator expansion.


—description from the publisher

Somewhat similar to the party game No Way!, but without the bluffing element. Each card in the game has a category - such as Marvel superheroes or traditional dishes - with six items in it, some true and some false, but all sounding like they could be true. The player in turn reads out the items and the other players mark them as right/wrong on their personal sheets, the correct row is then read out, and those with the most correct answers in it get a point. After every player has had the chance to be José three times, the game is over and those with the most total points win.

This is part of Tactic's small box travel games series.

When the three dice tumble from the dice tower, you must find a card in your hand that does not match any of the 3 attributes on each dice! Watch out for the wild raccoon card as 2 played will result in both captured!

Be the fastest to correctly get rid of your cards to win!

In this party game you tests your ability to connect the unconnected as much as it does the knowledge of your friends. Can you figure out what the words crime, yacht and battle have in common?
A creative, communicative party game for 4-12 players matching the right words!

TASTE, BET, DISCOVER, AND WHO KNOWS, WIN THE GAME!

A worthy spiritual successor to the successful game Mystery Wine, Bière Mystère allows you to discover more than 50 beers from Quebec microbreweries! Bière Mystère invites you to learn about beer by focusing on its visual, olfactory and taste properties, its transparency, its style, its bitterness and its alcohol content. Each game allows you to discover a mystery beer.

All information is validated by beerologists and brewers.

—description from the publisher (translated)

DÉGUSTEZ, MISEZ, DÉCOUVREZ, ET QUI SAIT,GAGNEZ LA PARTIE !

Digne successeur spirituel du jeu à succès Vin Mystère, Bière Mystère permet de découvrir plus de 50 bières de microbrasseries Québécoises !  Bière Mystère vous propose d’en apprendre sur la bière en misant sur ses propriétés visuelles, olfactives et gustative, sa transparence, son style, son amertume et son taux d’alcool. Chaque partie vous permet de découvrir une bière mystère.

Toutes les informations sont validées par des biérologues et des brasseurs.

—description from the publisher

ã‚¬ãƒ‹ãƒ¡ãƒ‡æˆ¦è¨˜Zero 2 (The War Chronicles of Ganymede Zero 2) is a two player card game from Japan in which Mechs are enhanced with transparent cards.

In 209X, Nigaleos, who was contracted for development by the Veil Army, was developing two types of Mechs, one specialized in attack and one specialized in defense. The airframe was built at both the research base and the production base.
The introduction of this 'Mech to the front line should have brought the battle on Ganymede to an end quickly. MEC engineers believed so and continued development. But Nigaleos executives had a different idea.

Ganymede Senki Zero2 is a standalone expansion for ã‚¬ãƒ‹ãƒ¡ãƒ‡æˆ¦è¨˜Zero. You can play with it alone or mix it with ã‚¬ãƒ‹ãƒ¡ãƒ‡æˆ¦è¨˜Zero and play with up to 4 people.

A fantasy dueling card game with easy to learn rules and intuitive game mechanics.

In Tales are Real, two to four player fight with creature cards against each other. Each player has five creatures on the table and can equip them with item cards to make them mir powerful. On every turn, both player choose one of their creatures for battle. The creatures fight against each other and deal damage to each other. The damage depends on the creatures basic strength and equipment. Creature cards has special abilities to avoid or reduce damage. To activate the ability players has to roll the dice.

The goal of Tales are Real is to destroy as many creatures of your opponent as possible. The player who lost the most creature cards within five rounds, loses the game.

This big fish is hungry, and it’s LAUNCH time! Grab a launcher and let the fish food fly to the other side. Race to clear your side of all fish food first to win! No turns, no waiting, just start playing. Lots of laughs await! Set up and play in ~30 seconds!

—description from the publisher

In a zombified Tahiti Island, players draw cards from a pile placed in the center of the table. Among these cards are zombies (cats, lizards, sharks, whales, pigs, roosters…, each with a value point. On your turn you play as many card as you want or you pass, then you draw a card. When you draw a zombie card you have to play it in front of you or give it to a neighbor using action card you have in hands, which refer to a tahitian object or action. The player with the least "zombies points" when the draw pile is empty win the game.

The Battle of Saratoga is a low to moderate complexity tactical game covering the British attempt to break through the American lines. One player commands the British and their Hessian mercenaries and and the other player commands the American forces. The game takes about 90 minutes to play.

—description from the publisher

A party game combining reflex and speed.

The cards are in a pile in the middle of the table. On each of them, 2 mathematical operations and 2 words in the center, but also 4 numbers and 4 images on the edge. Only one correct association is possible. 
Ex : On a card, you have the word "lion" and a picture of lion. You can also have "24-5" and "19".

You have to be the first to find the right answer to win the card. The winner is the one with the most cards at the end of the stack.

Welcome to Letterkenny!
Join the hicks, skids, and hockey players and experience all of their problems in the World’s Most Popular game!

Buy a Hockey rink or team, your favorite Modean’s Pub or the Fishing Hole. Build shacks and barns on your properties. Try to avoid “Chorin’!” Find out who is the toughest guy in Letterkenny. Host a bush party, surf the dark web and win “back to back to back ships” in the local hockey championship!

Features special game tokens from the show including a beer bottle, truck, jeep, hockey skate, Shamrock and a German Shepherd dog – plus one mystery token you’ll find inside the box!

—description form the publisher

Your mission is to journey through outer space in your rocket ship trying to catch your opponents before they catch you! Be aware of black holes, they could lead to your undoing or they may be your flight path to victory!

Players roll a randomized number with the "ray gun" and moves the corresponding amount of spaces. If you land on another rocket ship, they're out! Be the first one to tag all your opponents!

A board game to learn to compost while having fun.

Transform into a compost bug with unique powers, roll the dice to get resources and compete or cooperate with your friends to have the best compost harvest.

But beware, this is a voracious race! You will have a secret menu to compost, events to solve and natural predators lurking around the compost bin that will complicate your personal objectives.

You´ll select from 9 bugs (each one with its own power and playstyle) and each round the compost bin, will receive a new organic for everyone to compost. Throw the 2 wooden dices, and gather resources to use them to compost the card that most suits you depending your objective and secret menu.
The first to compost 5 cards from the compost bin closes the game, after that everyone counts the points they have, and the bug with the higher score wins!

—description from the designer

Un Juego de mesa para aprender a compostar divirtiéndote.

Transformate en un bicho de la compostera con poderes únicos, tirá los dados para conseguir recursos y competí o cooperá con tus amigos para tener la mejor cosecha de compost.

¡Pero cuidado, esta es una carrera voraz! Tendrás un menú secreto que compostar, eventos que resolver y depredadores naturales acechando a la vuelta de la compostera que complicarán tu objetivo.

—description from the designer (Spanish)

It's the 1940s, and one of the judges, Hank Hankinson, is found murdered just prior to the start of the annual Chicago Dance Competition!  The dancers and staff of the Talk of the Town Dance Hall must search for clues to bring the killer to justice.

The host and up to 12 friends participate in a thematic murder mystery where everyone plays a role and everyone is a suspect.  The game contains two different outcomes.

It's the UNO matching card game everyone knows but featuring favorite characters from Encanto. Players still race to get rid of all their cards by matching color, number and character. When someone plays a special 'Wild Don't Talk' card, they choose a player who will not be allowed to talk (except to call "Uno") until Uno is called. And just like always, when a player is down to one card, they must shout, 'UNO!' Makes a great gift for card game lovers and Encanto fans ages 7 years and older. Colors and decorations may vary.

The classic UNO card game builds fun on game night with themes inspired by Encanto.
Each game features a deck decorated with character graphics from beloved show!
As in classic UNO game, players match colors, numbers and symbols to the card on top of the discard pile!
A special 'Wild Don't Talk' rule may force some player to not talk.
Makes a great gift for kid, teen, adult and family game nights with 2 to 10 players ages 7 years and older!

—description from the publisher

This is a limited-time promotional item from KFC from December 2022.

Kentucky Duo features the same game play as its parent Spot it! but there are fewer symbols in the cards, so it follows that there are fewer cards as well.

Each card features six different KFC related symbols, with the symbols varying in size from one card to the next. Any two cards have exactly one symbol in common. For the basic Spot it! game, reveal one card, then another. Whoever spots the symbol in common on both cards gets rid of they first card, then another card is revealed for the player to search, and so on. Whoever has got rid of all their cards first, wins!

—user summary

Puzzle together, or in teams against each other, and find out which title is hidden behind the illustrated picture.
The 200 picture puzzles cover the four categories: Movies & Series, Music artists, Songs & Albums, Book, Stage & Stories.

The more difficult the puzzle, the more points you can get - but don't get too excited, because the puzzles are quite challenging. Thinking around the corner is absolutely desired and necessary! If you need help (and this will happen sooner than you think), you'll find hints on the back of the card and of course the correct solution. Good luck with the ultimate puzzle challenge!

—description from the publisher

Viva Quiz Vegas is a tricky multiple-choice quiz where you bet on right or wrong answers. If you use your cards skillfully, you can get points even if you are clueless. Are you drawing a blank? Then use your Thief card to steal points from other players. Lure the copycats with the bluff card on the wrong track or let their bet go up in smoke with the bomb! In this quiz, your knowledge is only worth something if you also play your hand correctly!
Play poker with bets on right and wrong answers.
500 creative multiple-choice questions test general knowledge.
Bets are placed face down - bluffing and nasty tricks guaranteed!

—description from the publisher

A new episodic game that reimplements Twin Stars.

Each episode includes a Scenary postcard and 2 cards.

A few big updates from Twin Stars. A lot mostly in the visual side. It uses cubes, and it uses them on the card instead of using the edges of the card for tracking. Characters have skills, store items and other things on their cards. You can also gain Hide or Hunt. With Hide, you can re-roll an alert die (which is an extra die, not a die on an alert symbol), and Hunt allows you to try for an extra star.


Scenario: Protect the Village

The village of Behyrst is being plagued by Addos the Vampire Princess, who has been using her bloodlust to reduce the already small village down to a small band of survivors. It's currently at a meager six, including you. But you can turn this around with some morale, support and defences. Her bite is fatal, and she's out for blood.

You need to successfully banish the Vampire Princess with three villagers to win before she kills too many more.

Characters:

     Machilo
     Unora-Vae

One of the most famous battles of the Zulu war, a small band of British defended against thousands of Zulu warriors. Watch for Zulu Snipers! Fall Back to gain strategic advantages! Hold the position to earn medals and respect in England. It is all here in this amazing, simple to learn game.

Background:

(1879) The Battle of Rorke's Drift, was an engagement in the Anglo-Zulu War. The successful British defense of the mission station of Rorke's Drift, began when a large contingent of Zulu warriors broke off from their main force at the day-long Battle of Isandlwana on 22 January 1879, diverting 6 miles (9.7 km) to attack the British, under the command of Lieutenants John Chard of the Royal Engineers and Gonville Bromhead, 24th Regiment of Foot at Rorke's Drift later that day and continuing into the following day. The massive but piecemeal attacks by the Zulu on Rorke's Drift came very close to defeating the much smaller garrison, but were consistently repelled. Just over 150 British and colonial troops defended the station against attacks by 3,000 to 4,000 Zulu warriors. Eleven Victoria Crosses were awarded among the defenders, along with a number of other decorations and honors.

—description from the publisher

Commonly known as the Stand of the 300, Thermopylae was an amazing battle. The Persian Empire troops, led by Xerxes I, faced 300 Greek forces, led by the Spartans, led by Leonidas. Are you able to hold off the Persians? Are you able to defeat them before the flanking forces attack from the surrounding hills? Stand and become the object of legends!

Background:

(480 BC) The Battle of Thermopylae was fought between the Achaemenid Persian Empire under Xerxes I and an alliance of Greek city-states led by Sparta under Leonidas I.The engagement at Thermopylae occurred simultaneously with the Battle of Artemisium: between July and September 480 BC.  Lasting over the course of three days, it was one of the most prominent battles of both the second Persian invasion of Greece which, under Xerxes I was a delayed response to the failure of the first Persian invasion which had been initiated by Darius I and ended in 490 BC by an Athenian-led Greek victory at the Battle of Marathon.  Xerxes had amassed a massive land and naval force, and set out to conquer all of Greece. The Athenian politician and general Themistocles proposed that the allied Greeks block the advance of the Persian army at the pass of Thermopylae.

—description from the publisher

Global War 1936-1945v4


     After more than 1000 hours of development over the last 4 years, Historical Board Gaming is proud to present Global War 1936 version 4.
     Listing the changes is an impossible task. Every component in the game and every sentence in the rules has been scrutinized. In many ways, version 4 is a totally new game compared to version 3.  
     We have done a lot of streamlining to make the game faster to play, and easier for new players to pick up. This includes removing things that did not work well or were unnecessarily complicated. 
     A tremendous amount has been added to the game: an all-new map, revised diplomacy, more balanced units, and enhanced technologies. Everything is now much more integrated. One of the biggest new additions are the “in port” rules, which will transform the game in many ways.
     In any 3-alliance system, the rules open up possibilities to gaming the system. Although a lot has been done to reduce/eliminate this in version 4, Global War has been designed to be played like gentlemen. As such, it is our hope that players aspire to this, and “play the game”, instead of “playing the rules”. The former is a lot more fun!
     Printed on new 13oz vinyl.
     Improved Jungle and Tundra terrain.
     Sea Floor Topography.
     Play aids such as Monroe Doctrine, kamikaze, Objectives, etc printed on the map.
     Sea Zones numbering (Atlantic A1. A2, A3..., Pacific P1, P2..., Indian Ocean and the Mediterranean.)


—description from the publisher

You only have one job, so don't mess it up! Climb up the corporate ladder by memorizing the fun sound effects and gestures for your task and those of the other players while keeping the rhythm going. If you make three misses, you will be fired. The last worker standing wins the game!

Crosschecking is the most rough boardgame ever. In every championship you play, you can face up friends and foes through the exciting experience of a hockey match full of unexpected events. The only thing that matters is the Prestigio Cup.

Use your sense of position and your strategic skills to leverage the right cards and sink your opponents. Build up the final roster and win the league.
Your team will consist of one Captain, one Goalie, and four skaters. Bear attention to the skills of your team members, they could be the difference between win and defeat.

—description from the designer

Each player gets a worm head and place the worm heads next to one another at the same level.
Each player takes 3 worm sections cards in his hand. Then place 6 worm section cards in the middle of the table and the remaining cards form the face-down draw pile.
On his turn, each player puts a card from your hand face down next to the 6 cards in the middle of the table. After that, takes a different card from there, reveal it and add it as a worm section to your worm.
When all players have added their ninth worm section, the game ends. The player who has the longest worm wins.

Borix is a game that takes place in a small village haunted by werewolves. Each player is secretly assigned a role: Wolf, Gofrix, Fairy, etc
A narrator is needed as well, the Moon player covers this role. 
The game alternates between the night and day phases. During the night the wolves kill a Gofrix. During the day the players still alive will deliberate and vote to get rid of the player they think is a wolf.
This is a social deduction game, either the wolves win by eating all Gofrix or the Gofrix win by getting rid of the wolves.



En el reino de Borix suuceden asesinatos espontáneos cada noche, los Gofrix tienen sus poblados en los cuales intentan resolver día con día queines son los causantes de estos sucesos, antes que los hombres los erradiquen por completo, desafortunadamente estos se reproducen rápidamente y podrían dominar la localidad hasta extenderse a todo el reino.

A million likes, comics, magic dice and an android invasion in the classrooms that will have to be stopped?

To win more likes on the interactive platform of the new trendy series "PUNCH and KiSS" you have to look like the main characters.

But this obsessive quest for popularity has gotten out of hand for most of the students and they have become a kind of zombie-humanoids with catastrophic consequences: they behave according to the dictates and models of fiction and harass anyone who still retains their difference?

Will you manage to give them back their humanity with the help of magic dice and restore coexistence in the classroom, before the platform reaches 1,000,000 likes and the mutation becomes irreversible?

4 WAYS TO PLAY!

STOP android bullying!
    The value of being different!
    The social network ("I like you").
    The "Squid Command" against android invasion

—description from the publisher (translated)

Un millón de likes, cómics, dados mágicos y una Invasión androide en las aulas que habrá que detener...

Para ganar más likes en la plataforma interactiva de la nueva serie de moda “PUNCH and KiSS” hay que parecerse a sus personajes protagonistas.

Pero esta búsqueda obsesiva de popularidad se le ha ido de las manos a la mayoría de estudiantes y se han convertido en una especie de zombis-humanoides con consecuencias catastróficas: se comportan según los dictados y modelos de la ficción y acosan a quien todavía conserva su diferencia...

¿Lograréis devolverles su humanidad con la ayuda de los dados mágicos y recuperar la convivencia en las aulas, antes que la plataforma alcance 1.000.000 de likes y la mutación sea irreversible?

¡4 FORMAS DE JUEGO!

¡STOP acoso androide!
    ¡El valor de ser diferentes!
    La red social (“I like you”)
    “El Comando Calamar" contra la invasión androide

—description from the publisher
